text: Fatma Kamal Shaker (), better known by her stage name Shadia, (8 February 1931 â€“ 28 November 2017) was an Egyptian actress and singer. She was famous for her roles in light comedies and drama in the 1950s and 1960s. Her first appearance was in the movie el-Aql Fi Agaza (The Mind on Vacation). She retired after her last movie La Tas'alni Man Ana (Don't Ask Me Who I Am). She was born in Cairo. Shadia was hospitalized on 4 November 2017, after suffering a massive stroke in Cairo. She was placed under intensive care and on 9 November, was in stable condition. On 28 November 2017, Shadia died at hospital in Cairo of respiratory failure, aged 86. == Photos == == References == == Other websites == * * Lost Continent: Cinema of Egypt Category:1931 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Deaths from respiratory failure Category:Egyptian movie actors Category:Egyptian singers Category:Actors from Cairo Category:Disease-related deaths in Egypt
title: Shadia
